modName: Far Off ENB - The Pacific Northwest
summary: This is a re-upload of my original Far Off ENB which attempts to recreate the look and feel of the American Pacific Northwest.
descriptionHtml:
[center][b][color=#00ff00][size=4][center]For the darker nights version of this mod, please visit my blog.
All updates will be posted on my blog going forward. Thank you for your continued support and enthusiasm!

[url=http://faroffmods.blogspot.com/]faroffmods[/url][/center][/size][/color][/b][/center]

[center][img]http://faroffmods.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/faroffenb-page-2.jpg[/img]

[youtube]RFGSVAAWJhQ[/youtube][youtube]l7lAKTHmlJY[/youtube]
[youtube]6QHCGFxeJCA[/youtube][youtube]ty4tBGYrWWY[/youtube]

[b]This is a re-upload of my original Far Off ENB which attempts to recreate the look and feel of the American Pacific Northwest. I recommend v2.5 and think it was the best of the 3 versions I created for this particular theme. Have fun trying them all out :) I will upload the other updates to this mod soon.[/b][/center][b]

[color=#008000][b]REQUIRED:[/b][/color]
=============

[url=http://www.mediafire.com/?6gy5cpg1vd0aqxp]ENB Binary v0.155[/url][b](You only need the d3d9.dll file)[/b]
(I will try to update the binary to the latest ENB version soon.)


[color=#008000][b]INSTALLATION:[/b][/color]
=============

0.As with all ENB configurations. BE SURE TO CHANGE [color=#008000][b]bFloatPointRendertarget=1 [/b][/color] in your skyrimprefs.ini file.

1. DELETE any leftover, like the EFFECT.TXT file located in skyrim folder if you are coming from a different ENB config.. Disable any other Grapical mod: CoT, RLFX, etc. this config is meant to be used with Vanilla game, nothing more is supported at this time. However, feel free to experiment.

2. Copy all the files to your Skyrim directory (where TESV.exe is located), click yes if asked to overwrite. Don't forget to put the ENB binary file here as well.


[color=#008000][b]TIPS AND TWEAKS:[/color][/b]
=============

Please visit my blog for detailed instructions and helpful tips to get your game looking like mine :)
This includes mods used for the look shown in my screenshots.
[url=http://faroffmods.blogspot.com/]Far Off Mods[/url]

Please see my other ENB creations...
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56548/?]Far Off ENB - Nirn (Pure Weather and ELFX ready)[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/56727/?]Far Off ENB - Nirn - For COT and ELFX[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50764/?]Far Off ENB - CGI Series[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/48144//]Far Off ENB - Claymay[/url]

No lighting mods were used when making this ENB therefore, I cannot recommend them, but there is a good chance they will all be compatible since no light adaption was used and direct lighting is minimal. [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/24460]Supreme and Volumetric Fog by Manny GT[/url] is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

I also used [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/20100/?]Sunglare disabler by MannyGT[/url]

[img]http://faroffmods.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/faroffenb-page-3.jpg[/img]
[img]http://faroffmods.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/faroffenb-page-4-update.jpg[/img]
[img]http://faroffmods.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/faroffenb-page-5.jpg[/img]
[img]http://faroffmods.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/faroffenb-page-6.jpg[/img]
[img]http://faroffmods.files.wordpress.com/2013/03/faroffenb-page-7.jpg[/img][/center]
